TopicTitle: What do you LOVE about KSP?

Articles.Content:
What's your favorite thing about KSP?

Recently I have been enjoying some lovely crafts that I made using QuizTech Aerospace and BDArmory.

I love the ability to create almost anything,but still test it to the physics.I love those YES! moments when you get a craft to work.I love playing in career mode with everything unlocked so I can do whatever but still get science and stuff(because why else go into space)!
I love being able to mod it into a proper spaceflight simulator. I most especially love that there are people who share the same passion for realism on these forums.
^True,especially since there are no other space simulators that have Jebediah the Bad-S.
I love that I can shoot odd contraptions into space without the Feds kicking down my door. It's a win win.

^True,especially since there are no other space simulators that have Jebediah the Bad-S.
Or a Linux client. Or the equivalent of KSP's VAB and SPH.
I love building infrastructure. And the flexibility in the layout of the infrastructure.

I love the unrestricted creativity. I can build Tanks, Ships, Buildings, Machines. Turrets, And submarines OUT OF SPACESHIP PARTS!

That's what I love.
Just the ingenuity of the game, rocket science, science science, aero-dynamics, drag, physics, etc... whens the black hole update coming?
I love building insane contraptions!

The explosions! Booms every where!

Also the kerbals themselves are awesome.
I love how it makes spaceÃ¢â€žÂ¢ easy. You don't need to be an MIT grad to slap a few tanks on an engine, say "that should be enough to get me there" and go. No need for stupid math.
I love the open-endedness of it!

In real life I have never flown a spaceplane into orbit and docked with a space station. I have never re-entered the atmosphere in a spaceplane directly over an airport in a perfect position for a (somewhat bouncy) landing.

These things and many others KSP allows me to do. Makes me feel like hotshot pilot, rocket scientist and mission control all in one.

I love that (most) of the game is easily moddable via config files.

That and, depending on my mood, alternating between carefully planned out missions with meticulously designed craft and building random crazy stuff and blowing up the KSC.

I love how it inspires learning simply by presenting challenges. "Go from here, to the moon. Here's your box of parts - have fun!" Finally accomplishing goals that are mostly set by yourself is quite a rush, after all of the work and iteration that had to happen to make it possible. Then, seemingly all of a sudden, I find myself plotting gravity assists through the Joolian moons while listening to podcasts about the history of rocketry.

Leave it to a moderator to fight all the recent hate with some KSP love....

That feeling you get as a noob, when you don't know how to fly the navball. Dithering over the Mun, trying to eyeball when horizontal velocity is gone, trying to descend at a safe speed, closer, closer... still drifting sideways when making contact, it's trying to fall over downhill... but it settles back on the landing gear! You did it! The first landing on the Mun! :cheers!:

That is what I love about KSP

Now whaddaya mean the hatch is obstructed? :facepalm:

What? Wrong thread?
The ability to explore and do whatever you want.

I love KSP because of how unique it is, its modding support, and the exploration aspect of it, and the fact that, with mods, you can make pretty much whatever you want (until you reach the game's limits).

This isn't a criticism thread though, so I'll leave my other opinions alone for another post.
